intro: Galactia buchii, commonly known as the yellow burr legume, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruit is a hairy, three-lobed pod that matures into a spiny, woody structure. Galactia buchii is often found in moist, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in woodland and savanna habitats.
